title: SEC Net Capital Requirements for Broker-Dealers
body:
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION - NET CAPITAL REQUIREMENTS FOR BROKER-DEALERS

ยง 240.15c3-1 Net capital requirements for brokers or dealers.

Every broker or dealer must at all times have and maintain net capital in an amount not less than the greatest of the following:

(a) MINIMUM NET CAPITAL: Every broker-dealer shall maintain minimum net capital of $250,000. For firms carrying customer accounts, the minimum shall be $1,000,000.

(b) CAPITAL ADEQUACY RATIO: Broker-dealers must maintain a capital adequacy ratio of at least 8% of risk-weighted assets. The ratio must be calculated using the aggregate debit balances of customer accounts.

(c) LIQUIDITY REQUIREMENTS: Firms shall maintain liquid assets equal to at least 120% of total liabilities. Liquid assets include cash, U.S. Treasury securities, and investment-grade corporate bonds.

(d) HAIRCUTS ON PROPRIETARY POSITIONS:
- Equity securities: 15% of market value
- Investment-grade debt: 2% of market value
- High-yield debt: 8% of market value
- Derivatives: Per Schedule A

(e) EARLY WARNING THRESHOLDS: A broker-dealer must notify the Commission if:
- Net capital falls below 120% of minimum requirement
- Aggregate indebtedness exceeds 1200% of net capital
- Capital adequacy ratio falls below 10%

(f) CUSTOMER PROTECTION: Firms carrying customer accounts must compute a reserve requirement daily and maintain a Special Reserve Bank Account for the Exclusive Benefit of Customers under 17 CFR 240.15c3-3.

(g) CONCENTRATION LIMITS: No broker-dealer shall have exposure to any single counterparty exceeding 25% of its net capital without prior approval.

(h) STRESS TESTING: Firms with net capital exceeding $500 million must conduct quarterly stress tests covering:
- Market risk scenarios
- Credit risk scenarios
- Liquidity stress scenarios

(i) REPORTING: Monthly FOCUS Report filings are required within 17 business days of month-end. Annual audited financials must be filed within 60 days of fiscal year-end.

(j) SANCTIONS: Failure to maintain required net capital is a violation of Section 15(c)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act and may result in:
- Suspension of operations
- Revocation of broker-dealer registration
- Civil monetary penalties up to $1,000,000 per violation
- Criminal prosecution under 15 U.S.C. ยง 78ff

This rule shall be effective 60 days after publication in the Federal Register.
